meta.name: description
meta.content:
Sheldon Independent School District is a public school district in unincorporated northeast Harris County, Texas (USA). The majority of the district lies in the extraterritorial jurisdiction of Houston with a small portion within city limits.

Sheldon ISD covers 53.5 square miles and serves several neighborhoods in the Sheldon Lake area. Administration for the district is headquartered in the Dr. Donald Ney Administration Complex with King Davis acting as superintendent. Since the early 2000s, strong enrollment growth has driven new construction and expansions throughout the district.

meta.content: Sheldon ISD, sheldon isd, Houston, houston, C. E. King, c. e. king, King, king, Panthers, panthers, Compass Schools, compass schools, Texas, texas

header.h2: Sheldon ISD to remain closed through the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year (June 3)

div.p:
Published 4/17/2020
Dear Sheldon ISD community,
Texas Governor Greg Abbott issued an executive order earlier today that will keep all public, private and higher educational institutions closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. He also mentioned that Texas Commissioner of Education Mike Morath would be providing additional information in the near future.
Sheldon ISD will continue its remote learning program through the remainder of the regular school year calendar through June 3, and it will also maintain its curbside meal distributions.
We also realize that you may have additional questions that may or may not have been addressed – such as high school graduation, summer school, etc. The district is currently in the process of creating an area on the Sheldon ISD website to help explain some of these gray areas.
Lastly, we ask that you continue to follow us on social media for the most up-to-date news and information regarding Sheldon ISD.
Thank you, and let’s continue to stay #SHELDONSTRONG!
Helpful Resources
Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC): https://www.cdc.gov
County Public Health Department: http://publichealth.harriscountytx.gov
--------------
El gobernador de Texas Greg Abbott emitió una orden ejecutiva hoy que mantendrá cerradas todas las escuelas durante el resto del año escolar 2019-2020. También mencionó que el Comisionado de Educación de Texas, Mike Morath, dara mas información en el futuro
Sheldon ISD continuará su programa de aprendizaje remoto durante el resto del calendario escolar regular hasta el 3 de junio, y también mantendrá sus distribuciones de comidas.
Mas informacion sobre preguntas adicionales, como la graduación de la escuela secundaria, la escuela de verano, se dara mas adelante. El distrito se encuentra actualmente en el proceso de crear un área en el sitio web de Sheldon ISD para ayudar a explicar algunas de estas preguntas.
Por último, le pedimos que continúe siguiéndonos en las redes sociales para obtener las noticias e información más actualizadas sobre Sheldon ISD.
¡Gracias y sigamos quedando #SHELDONSTRONG

figcaption.p: Please click on the image to be directed to the Remote Learning site.

Sheldon ISD has contracted with ESS to provide substitute services for our district. If you are interested in substitute teaching or as a substitute paraprofessional please contact ESS at 1-800-641-0140 or by visiting www.ess.com.
Sheldon ISD supports the American Heart Association's "Quit Lying" campaign to take a permanent stand against vaping.
New C. E. King High School ribbon cutting ceremony celebrated by Sheldon ISD community on Jan. 6, 2020.
All KHS students now eligible to ride school buses to new high school campus

div.div: Parents, here is the 2020-2021 school year calendar. If you would like to view and/or subscribe to the district and campus day-to-day calendars, please click HERE.

h3.a: Sheldon ISD to remain closed through the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year (June 3)

div.div:
Published 4/17/2020
Dear Sheldon ISD community,
Texas Governor Greg Abbott issued an executive order earlier today that will keep all public, private and higher educational institutions closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. He also mentioned that Texas Commissioner of Education Mike Morath would be providing additional information in the near future.
Sheldon ISD will continue its remote learning program through the remainder of the regular school year calendar through June 3, and it will also maintain its curbside meal distributions.
We also realize that you may have additional questions that may or may not have been addressed – such as high school graduation, summer school, etc. The district is currently in the process of creating an area on the Sheldon ISD website to help explain some of these gray areas.
Lastly, we ask that you continue to follow us on social media for the most up-to-date news and information regarding Sheldon ISD.

Sheldon ISD continuará su programa de aprendizaje remoto durante el resto del calendario escolar regular hasta el 3 de junio, y también mantendrá sus distribuciones de comidas.

h3.a: A heartfelt message from the Sheldon ISD Board of Trustees and Superintendent Dr. King Davis

img.alt: Community-Wide Food Drive set for Saturday (April 25) at new Sheldon ISD Panther Stadium Featured Photo

h3.a: Community-Wide Food Drive set for Saturday (April 25) at new Sheldon ISD Panther Stadium

div.div:
The Houston Food Bank, in conjunction with “A Collaboration of Community Hands,” will be hosting a community-wide Food Drive at the new Sheldon ISD Panther Stadium on Saturday, April 25, from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. (or whenever the food runs out).
Please make plans to come as early as possible, as there are only 80 pallets of food available for distribution.
We hope to see you at Panther Stadium this Saturday beginning at 9 a.m.
